item.title: AlexCTF CR3: What is this encryption? 150p
item.description: Fady assumed this time that you will be so n00b to tell what encryption he is using he send the following note to his friend in plain sight: p=0xa6055ec186de51800ddd6fcbf0192384ff42d707a55f57af4fcfb0d1dc7bd97055e8275cd4b78ec63c5d592f567c66393a061324aa2e6a8d8fc2a910cbee1ed9 q=0xfa0f9463ea0a93b929c099320d31c277e0b0dbc65b189ed76124f5a1218f5d91fd0102a4c8de11f28be5e4d0ae91ab319f4537e97ed74bc663e972a4a9119307 e=0x6d1fdab4ce3217b3fc32c9ed480a31d067fd57d93a9ab52b472dc393ab7852fbcb11abbebfd6aaae8032db1316dc22d3f7c3d631e24df13ef23d3b381a1c3e04abcc745d402ee3a031ac2718fae63b240837b4f657f29ca4702da9af22a3a019d68904a969ddb01bcf941df70af042f4fae5cbeb9c2151b324f387e525094c41 c=0x7fe1a4f743675d1987d25d38111fae0f78bbea6852cba5beda47db76d119a3efe24cb04b9449f53becd43b0b46e269826a983f832abb53b7a7e24a43ad15378344ed5c20f51e268186d24c76050c1e73647523bd5f91d9b6ad3e86bbf9126588b1dee21e6997372e36c3e74284734748891829665086e0dc523ed23c386bb520 He is underestimating our crypto skills! Recover d This challenge requires some knowledge about basic crypto algorithms. Based on the variables that Fady sent we assumed this was RSA. A formal definition of the RSA algorithm can be expressed as the following:

item.title: AlexCTF CR4:Poor RSA [200]
item.description: In this challenge we have a RSA public and a cipher text that we need to decypt. Since we know that RSA is broken only if we can factorize the modulus then thats is apperantly the goal. To extract the modulus we use openssl to extract that information: openssl rsa -noout -text -inform PEM -in key.pub -pubin Public-Key: (399 bit) Modulus: 52:a9:9e:24:9e:e7:cf:3c:0c:bf:96:3a:00:96:61: 77:2b:c9:cd:f6:e1:e3:fb:fc:6e:44:a0:7a:5e:0f: 89:44:57:a9:f8:1c:3a:e1:32:ac:56:83:d3:5b:28: ba:5c:32:42:43 Exponent: 65537 (0x10001) 52a99e249ee7cf3c0cbf963a009661772bc9cdf6e1e3fbfc6e44a07a5e0f894457a9f81c3ae132ac5683d35b28ba5c324243 To get the integer representation we run the following:
